qas.question: In which Olympics was Spielberg a flagbearer?
Where was Spielberg an Olympic flagbearer?
How did Time Magazine recognize Spielberg?

answers.text: one of the 100 Most Important People of the Century

qas.question: How did Life Magazine recognize Spielberg?

answers.text: the most influential person of his generation

qas.question: What honorary degree did Spielberg receive from Boston University?
Where were the 2006 Winter Olympics held?
Who did Time list as the most important person of the century?

context: In 2002, <b8_0>Spielberg<b8_0/> was one of eight flagbearers who carried the Olympic Flag into Rice-Eccles Stadium at the Opening Ceremonies of the <a0_0>2002 Winter Olympic Games<a0_0/> in <a1_0><b5_0>Salt Lake City<b5_0/><a1_0/>. In 2006, Premiere listed him as the most powerful and influential figure in the motion picture industry. Time listed him as <a2_0>one of the 100 Most Important People of the Century<a2_0/>. At the end of the 20th century, Life named him <a3_0>the most influential person of his generation<a3_0/>. In 2009, <b6_0><b7_0>Boston<b6_0/> University<b7_0/> presented him an honorary <a4_0>Doctor of Humane Letters<a4_0/> degree.
